com.locuslabs.sdk.maps.model

Interface ThemeBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConcreteThemeBuilder

    public interface ThemeBuilder
    The ThemeBuilder is used to create new Themes which can used to change the SDK's GUI properties. To modify an existing theme, you first create a new ThemeBuilder either starting with a base theme that you want to modify and/or using setProperty to assign the appropriate values. Once you have set all of the desired Theme properties, you can manipulate the SDK's Presentation Layer by using the Factory method createTheme().

    Example:
    Theme mCustomTheme = mapView.themeBuilder().setProperty("colors.custom",-1).createTheme()

    Since:
    1.2.5
    See Also:
    Theme

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Theme createTheme()
      Returns a Theme which can be utilized by the MapView method which modifies the SDK's presentation layer.
      ThemeBuilder setProperty(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object value)
      Set a ThemeBuilder property.

    • Method Detail

      • setProperty

        ThemeBuilder setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.Object value)
        Set a ThemeBuilder property. Upon setting the ThemeBuilder's current Theme's property, the ThemeBuilder is returned, allowing for method chaining.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property
        value - the new value, must be a Number, String, android.graphics.Typeface, android.graphics.Color
        Returns:
        ThemeBuilder

      • createTheme

        Theme createTheme()
        Returns a Theme which can be utilized by the MapView method which modifies the SDK's presentation layer.
        Returns:
        Theme
